author: M. Roscio (Guest)
title: No answer from modem
text:
Tried with both 0.3k and 0.3q, Ubuntu 11.10, BB 8520 by TIM.
Same problem as posted on 1st Apr 2012 by Vishrut, except that my BB doesn't ask for a password.
Uncommenting "debug" in conf/tim adds a message line:
Script /usr/sbin/chat -f ./conf/tim-chat finished (pid 3783), status = 0x1
Pid changes, status always 0x1.
Please feel free to ask for more info.
regards
mroscio@tin.it

author: MikeC (Guest)
title: Verizon Blackberry 9930
text: Installed the prereqs, as noted on the install page, on Ubuntu Lucid 10.04, connected my BB as USB drive, then ran 0.3q of bbtether (sudo berry4all.sh). Set File > Preferences, ran Device > Scan, disconnected and rebooted the BB (with a battery pull, as indicated.) berry4all has worked every time since.  Thanks for all your work on this!

author: admin
title: For 11.04
text:
Try this:
Just an FYI regarding Debian 6.0 (x64): I found that Berry4All stopped working when I switched from Ubuntu to Debian. Managed to track the problem down to the pppd config file. Debian 6.0 seems to require absolute paths to the chat scripts. Changing the file path fixed the problem.

Let me know if that works.

author: Guest (Guest)
title: My 2 cents.
text: For those of you using Mobilicity in Canada, copy the generic file generic and generic-chat and rename both mobilicity and mobilicity-chat.  The network name is www.davewireless.com

author: Guest (Guest)
title: My 2 cents.
text: Does not work with Ubuntu/Kubuntu 11.04(natty)

author: Jason (Guest)
title: Fix it, pls
text: so it cannot work with libusb-1.0.8... Thanks...

author: JParker (Guest)
title: run with sudo!
text:
For those of you getting the error "operation not permitted".  The simple resolution is to run berry4all.sh with sudo.

> sudo ./berry4all.sh

title: bb9630 works
text:
works great with ubuntu 8.04 and bb tour (verizon). 

once installed and the verizon config file was edited, to reflect my phone_number@vzw3g.com, all was sweet.

Although, I had to search for the berry4all.sh file to get it started (found in my case in: home/user/berry4all/src/bbtether/) ....

I extracted all that to my home file, but there seems to be no executable or install file.   Totally lost... any help will be appreciated.

author: Dundy (Guest)
title: thethering BB 9500 on Win7 x64 problems
text:
I have spent 3-4 days, trying to get thethering working. I have installed most recent DM. I saw that people were having problems using BT connection for tethering BB. So I disabled Bluetooth on the BB, removed the paired BT (BB) device from the PC. Now the Control Panel / Devices doesn?t show any exclamation mark. However, when I start DM, it doesn?t show IP modem option, this is what I see (might be called differently in English version)

BB Media Sync, Application Loader, Restore / Recovery, Transferring data from one BB to the other, Synchronization.

Should IP modem be shown as well? It doesn?t show for me. I dunno why, I even installed the USB / Modem drivers from RIM site:

BlackBerry - Software Downloads 2

I tried using manual tethering settings based on this site:
http://www.l0pht.com/dildog/bb-win-tether/index.html

The most basic problem I face is that when I get to this point ?You'll get a dialog that looks like this (this dialog doesn't have COM4, because i wrote this tutorial after installing the modem...)? ? this window that?s shown on the webpage I never get. When I click next, it just installs modem, and list of devices shows Standard 33600 bps modem with a yellow exclamation mark next to it. I cannot edit properties, and I cannot chose port. All this, even though Virtual Serial Ports are available shown in Step 2.

author: Guest (Guest)
title: My 2 cents.
text: fedora 11 x86_64, blackberry bold 9700, usb tether. The device is seen usb side. It appears to be seen by B4A as it claims a ppp0 device is connected etc. I see no ppp0 anywhere on the system. Ultimately is just times out never receiving an IP, never showing Modem Mode on the phone, and no ppp0 device or similar ever appearing. Right after it times out one of the CPU cores goes to 100% and will continue at that until I tell it Modem->Disconnect even though it reports its already disconnected. Ive seen no 'errors' in messages, in the verbose output nor the likes of AVC denials etc. Not sure whats wrong but my 2 cents is F11 x86_64 + 9700 == doesnt work.  Any suggestions?

author: Dave (Guest)
title: Sprint?
text:
I try and get this working over usb with my BB Curve 8830.
It keeps failing. Any ideas?

author: egrep (Guest)
title: Nexus one?
text: This worked great on Ubuntu Linux and a bb tour. I am now playing with my Nexus. It is unlocked, and the usb port is in dev debug mode. The computer sees the nexus as being from Google, but "No RIM device found" I will search for a config file that might let me try different connect strings. I am on a unlimited 3G plan, and need not get the carrier to enable tethering [as far as I know ;-]. I am running PDANet tethering software and it says it is ready... Let the fun begin. Thanks! steve at pirk dot com

author: sam (Guest)
title: vodafone uk
text:
Great work!
For those who use vodafone uk, the following worked for me
file name "conf/vodafone"
------------------------

# was tested as working by Me
#460800
115200
noipdefault
defaultroute
#nomultilink
ipcp-restart 7
ipcp-accept-local
ipcp-accept-remote
lcp-echo-interval 0
lcp-echo-failure 99
nopcomp
noaccomp
#noauth
nomagic
noccp
crtscts
pap-timeout 20
pap-restart 20
lcp-restart 10
novj
user "web"
password "web"
usepeerdns

#debug debug debug
# does not exist in all pppd versions (osx)
replacedefaultroute

connect "/usr/sbin/chat -f conf/vodafone-3g-chat"


-------------------------------------

filename : "conf/vodafone-3g-chat"

--------------------------------
TIMEOUT 10
ABORT 'BUSY'
ABORT 'NO ANSWER'
ABORT 'ERROR'
SAY 'Starting GPRS connect script\n'

'' 'BBT_OS'
'' 'ATZ'
OK 'AT+CGDCONT=1,"IP","internet"'
ABORT 'NO CARRIER'
SAY 'Dialing...\n'
OK 'ATD*99#'
CONNECT
~p



-----------------

Happy surfing

Sam

author: admin
title: Installing without internet connection
text:
This is pretty difficult, if you can use a wired connection to install berry4all once and for all that would be way easier (Installing berry4all is trivial but the apt-get dependencies are much more painful).
If you want to do it without connection at all, you can try this:
http://basicubuntu.blogspot.com/2009/02/install-on-ubuntu-without-internet.html

author: cappie (Guest)
title: Response to AaronL about Ubuntu 9.10x64, Blackberry 8330m, Sprint
text: I used the same procedure with bbtether.py with Ubuntu 9.10X32, bb 8330, and Verizon. Reboot the bb via shutdown and remove battery for 1 min. When bb comes back, ensure network connection before trying again with the command $sudo python bbtether.py verizon

author: Guest (Guest)
title: almost there
text:
thanks for the application...will help a lot once i get it working.  

everything installed and it sees my 8830 but when I try to connect modem i get the following error:
Could NOT unload module berry_charge ! (must be in use)
You should probably blacklist it
create a file as root called: /etc/modprobe.d/blackberry
inside it write 'blacklist berry_charge' (without the quotes)
save it, then unplug the blackberry
run  "sudo /etc/init.d/udev restart"
replug the blackberry and try again

followed instructions but still no dice..any thoughts?
